title: Learning to Drive
description: Learning to drive is a key skill for independence. It involves understanding traffic rules, mastering vehicle control, and developing road awareness to ensure your safety and that of others.
sentences: Enroll in a reputable local driving school to learn from a certified instructor.
Obtain your learner's license from the local RTO before you start practicing on public roads.
Thoroughly learn and understand all traffic signs, signals, and road markings.
Practice consistently, starting in empty grounds or low-traffic areas and gradually moving to busier roads.
Learn basic car maintenance like checking tire pressure, engine oil, and coolant levels.
dos: Always wear your seatbelt, and ensure your co-passengers do too.
Be patient and defensive. Assume other drivers might make mistakes.
Master the use of mirrors and indicators for changing lanes and turning.
Practice parking, especially parallel parking, as it's often the trickiest part.
donts: Don't use your mobile phone while driving, not even on speaker or with earphones.
Don't drive without a valid learner's license (with a licensed co-driver) or a permanent license.
Don't get intimidated by honking from other vehicles; focus on driving safely.
